unit_learning_outcomes.description: collaborate on screen production projects while individually researching, and engaging in, specialized roles.
evaluate critically one's own and others' creative screen projects.
differentiate technical and creative strategies through a critical analysis of creative screen works.
synthesise practical, conceptual and analytical skills through the writing, development and collaborative realisation of a creative screen concept.

enrolment_rules.description: 130cp at 1000 level or above including MAS213 or MMCC2013

assessments.assessment_title: Portfolio: Video Essay and Study Plan
assessments.description: Portfolio: Video Essay and Study Plan.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: MMCC3013 - Screen Production: Open Form Filmmaking

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit offers students an opportunity to develop their creative, conceptual, and technical abilities through the collaborative production of fiction, non-fiction, hybrid, or experimental screen projects of their choice across different media. They are encouraged to step up to new creative challenges in roles they have an affinity for, such as directing, producing, cinematography, production design, editing or sound design. The creative opportunities of this unit can produce work suitable for professional portfolios and entry into film festivals.
